properties.Name: Heritage Walk Loop (East)
properties.CAPTION: A historical walk continuing through the Heritage Conservation Area of old St. John's. See the new architectural styles that emerged after the Great Fire of 1892.

properties.Name: Elizabeth Avenue-Prince Phillip East (North)
properties.CAPTION: This sidewalkway features a blend of residential, commercial, government and institutional properties. The north section of the walk passes by the Confederation Building and former farmsteads, that once supplied townspeople with produce.

properties.Name: Elizabeth Avenue-Prince Phillip West Walk (North)
properties.CAPTION: This sidewalkway follows the first, major, divided thoroughfare in St. John's, and takes you through Atlantic Canada's largest University.

properties.Name: Signal Hill Road
properties.CAPTION: This invigorating Walk up Signal Hill Road follows one of the oldest and most scenic routes in the City.
properties.Parking: Duckworth Street, Signal Hill Visitor Centre

properties.Name: GEO-Vista Park
properties.CAPTION: Eight looped trails in the Johnson GEO Park guide you through inspiring views and informative outdoor displays. Completed in 2007, the park wraps around the Johnson GEO CENTRE, a geological interpretation centre built deep into ancient glacial bedrock.

properties.Name: Harbourside Park to Kent's Pond Link (North)
properties.CAPTION: This Sidewalkway links the downtown Harbourfront with Kent's Pond along one of the oldest routes leading out of St. John's

properties.Name: Elizabeth to Courthouse Link
properties.CAPTION: Start in Churchill Square and walk from modern, post-war St. John's down to the heart of the old St. John's. Pass by old churches and end your stroll in the centre of the St. John's heritage conservation area.

properties.Name: Mundy Pond to Waterford Link
properties.CAPTION: As St. John's became a bigger capital city, in the 1800's, opportunities for manufacturing emerged. This walk takes you where some of these industries existed and through neighbourhoods that grew up around them.

properties.Name: Mundy Pond to Bowring Park Link
properties.CAPTION: Mostly following along Columbus Drive, walkers of this sidewalkway will look upon the Waterford Valley and Southside Hills as they head toward Bowring Park.

properties.Name: Mundy Pond-Cowan-Bowring Link
properties.CAPTION: From Mundy Pond, this walk follows the course of Mundy Pond Brook before turning south through Cowan Avenue. This walk passes through residential developments, park systems and commercial areas before connecting to Bowring Park.

properties.Name: Peter Barry Duff Memorial Park
properties.CAPTION: The Walk for this memorial park passes through youth sports facilities before looping to explore the natural landscape surrounding the popular swimming hole, Topsail Round Pond.

properties.Name: Rotary Sunshine Park (Healey's Pond)
properties.CAPTION: Established 1937 for underpriviledged children, Rotary 'Sunshine' Park, has now become popular for swimming enthusiasts. Quiet backcountry trails offer scenic views of Portugal Cove-St. Philip's

properties.Name: Rainbow Gully Park
properties.CAPTION: A new addition the Grand Concourse, the Town of Portugal Cove-St. Philip's has established a large, scenic recreational space with trails, a synthetic turf soccer pitch, and playgrounds at Rainbow Gully.

properties.Name: Battery to Signal Hill
properties.CAPTION: A short attractive walk linking Signal Hill with downtown. One section is rugged but offers spectacular views of the City and surrounding landscape. The walk encircles Deadman's Pond with the Johnson GEO Centre across the street.

properties.Name: Bidgood Park
properties.CAPTION: Donated by the Bidgood Family in 2003, this park features extensive trails and boardwalk winding through mixed forest and wetland habitats. See the Gerald Squires sculpture 'The Mower' dedicated to the agricultural community of Goulds.

properties.Name: Caribou Hill Park
properties.CAPTION: Connecting to the Newfoundland T'Railway, this short walk connects older manor houses and historic homes to modern suburbs.

properties.Name: Confederation Hill
properties.CAPTION: Stroll through the Confederation Building grounds around the main seat of our Government. Many historic plaques and monuments overlook the City.

properties.Name: Elizabeth Park
properties.CAPTION: This Walk follows a stream which flows through the quiet neighbourhood of Elizabeth Park, the first big subdivision in the Town of Paradise.

properties.Name: Harbourside Walk (East)
properties.CAPTION: Fabulous views, narrow streets, and traditional Newfoundland homes comprise this walk, through a historical fishing community.

properties.Name: Harbourside Walk (North)
properties.CAPTION: Along the waterfront of the older City in North America, interesting Historyboards tell the fascinating story of the development of this City. Along this walk, learn about the modern harbour, and observe the activity of this busy port.

properties.Name: Harbourside Park to Kent's Pond Link (South)
properties.CAPTION: This Sidewalkway links the downtown Harbourfront with Kent's Pond along one of the oldest routes leading out of St. John's

properties.Name: Harbourside Walk (South)
properties.CAPTION: Breathtaking views and tranquility greet walkers at Fort Amherst, the highlight of this walk. Walkers will see remnants of wartime activity, watch fisherman at work, pass through a traditional community, and enjoy pleasing views of the City and the sea.

properties.Name: Virginia River to Kenny's Pond
properties.CAPTION: This walk follows the course of a buried river tributary, passing through open spaces, and playgrounds, in a modern suburban neighbourhood.

properties.Name: Kenny's Pond
properties.CAPTION: The popular Kenny's Pond Park offers a leisurely stroll or a quick walk and provides many opportunities to watch waterfowl. Reminisce about the barrens and farmland that once encircled this Pond.

properties.Name: Kents Pond
properties.CAPTION: Winding through sheltered woodlands, this peaceful walk conceals the hustle and bustle of the City.

properties.Name: Kents Pond to Long Pond
properties.CAPTION: This walk connects Long Pond to Kent's Pond, passing through forest and wetland before skirting around the Confederation Complex. Loop around the two ponds for a longer walk.

properties.Name: Oxen Pond to Wishingwell
properties.CAPTION: Linking Oxen Pond to Wishingwell Park, this walk will take you through scenic forested areas and along one of the last remaining farming areas in this section of the City.

properties.Name: Mundy Pond
properties.CAPTION: Many fitness enthusiasts enjoy this looped trail for exercise, but Mundy Pond has also become a major draw for birdwatchers as migrating shorebirds join the resident waterfowl in the autumn of the year.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Waterford River West)
properties.CAPTION: The route of the former railbed continues through the historic Bowring Park - established in 1914. Continue this level Walk west to enter the City of Mount Pearl.
properties.Parking: Mackey Place, Bowring Park east lot

properties.Name: Sunrise Trail
properties.CAPTION: Like the other walks in Mount Pearl, this trail winds through forested greenways, open spaces, and schoolyards before culminating at Power's Pond Park, where you can enjoy the serenity of nature and observe the waterfowl that call Powers Pond home.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Paradise)
properties.CAPTION: A continuation of the Newfoundland T'Railway, this walk follows the route of the old rail line through the Town of Paradise. This scenic Walk links three ponds (Brazil Pond, Neil's Pond and Octagon Pond) and some of the Townâ€™s major recreational spaces

properties.Name: Riverdale to Mundy Pond (West)
properties.CAPTION: Linking Rennies River Trail to Mundy Pond, this walk route takes the user through the Kelly's Brook Valley, connecting several municipal parks along the way (St. Pats Ball Park, Lions Park, Kelly's Brook Park and Wedgewood Park).

properties.Name: Trailer Park to Marine Institute
properties.CAPTION: This tranquil route connects the Marine Institute, Humane Services, Long Pond Walk, and Pippy Park.

properties.Name: Southlands
properties.CAPTION: Provided mainly for the residents in the Southlands subdivisions, this linear trail winds through scenic boreal forest while following southbrook and its surrounding wetland habitat.

properties.Name: Lake-to-Lookout
properties.CAPTION: Revitalize in the fresh, cool air of the North Atlantic as you follow this Walk from Quidi Vidi Lake to Cabot Tower on Signal Hill. From the various lookouts, witness the strength of the Hill's strategic wartime position.

properties.Name: Pinebud
properties.CAPTION: Connecting two Walks, Rennie's River and Elizabeth Avenue - Prince Phillip East, Pinebud detours through the first modern suburb of St. John's.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Waterford River Central)
properties.CAPTION: The walk continues along the T'Railway, passing through the Waterford River ravine amidst countryside heritage homes.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Waterford River East)
properties.CAPTION: The Trans Canada Trail starts with the Waterford River Walk at the Railway Coastal Museum and follows the former railbed. The Newfoundland Railway operated here until 1988, more than a century after railway service first started on the island.

properties.Name: Admiralty Walk
properties.CAPTION: This short Walk links Admiralty House with Arboretum Walk, passing through planned residential neighbourhoods in Mount Pearl. The Walk is part of the original walkway system designed when subdivisions were built here.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Arboretum Walk)
properties.CAPTION: This is our longest looped walk, taking you through most of the City of Mount Pearl before connecting back to the T'Railway. Explore the Waterford River ravine, farmland, City Parks and modern neighbourhoods.
properties.Parking: Power's Pond parking lot, Clyde Avenue

properties.Name: Branscombes Pond
properties.CAPTION: This quaint and tranquil Trail takes the walker along wide boardwalks and granular walk, providing views of the waterfowl and natural beauty of Branscombe's Pond. Viewing areas and rest spots are provided throughout.

properties.Name: Clovelly Walk
properties.CAPTION: This linear Trail connects Stavanger Drive residential developments with businesses, wetlands, and greenspaces in the Stavanger Drive area.

properties.Name: MUN Visitors Walk
properties.CAPTION: Visit the grounds of Memorial University and view the historyboards interpreting historical and institutional features of the campus.

properties.Name: Old St. John's Business Streets (Duckworth)
properties.CAPTION: In the 1700s and early 1800s Duckworth Street was the centre of town, with Fort William at the eastern end and the Governor's residence nearby. By the late 19th century, the street had developed into a commercial area.

properties.Name: Heritage Walk Loop (West)
properties.CAPTION: This walk takes you past distinctive 19th and 20th century architecture and the Ecclesiastical District, designated a National Historic Site in 2008.

properties.Name: Long Pond Walk (South)
properties.CAPTION: Trails and rest areas were constructed throughout the campus of Memorial University, extending around Long Pond and into Pippy Park. The Fluvarium, an aquatic intepretation centre, highlights the significance of this urban wetland.
properties.Parking: Fluvarium or metered parking on campus

properties.Name: Rennies River
properties.CAPTION: Meandering upstream along the course of the Rennie's River, this trail runs behind long-established neighbourhoods before passing through a peaceful wooded valley near Long Pond.

properties.Name: Neils Pond
properties.CAPTION: This walk around the shore of Neil's Pond offers a splendid escape to a natural world for residents of Paradise and nearby communities. The north side of the walk is part of the Newfoundland T'Railway.

properties.Name: Octagon Pond
properties.CAPTION: A nearly 5 km trail around Octagon Pond in Paradise provides both an ecological buffer and a central recreational space for the burgeoning municipality.

properties.Name: Long Pond Walk (North)
properties.CAPTION: Trails and rest areas were constructed throughout the campus of Memorial University, extending around Long Pond and into Pippy Park. The Fluvarium, an aquatic intepretation centre, highlights the significance of this urban wetland.

properties.Name: Virginia River (To Wedgewood Park)
properties.CAPTION: A perfect walk to enjoy the pleasures of the seasons and their change. At the rest areas, you can sit and enjoy the melodious songbirds.

properties.Name: Virginia River (To Logy Bay Road)
properties.CAPTION: This enchanting walk meanders along one of the world's most productive trout streams.

properties.Name: Virginia River (Airport Heights)
properties.CAPTION: From Rickketts Bridge, follow the streets and trails of Airport Heights along the Virginia River to the Airport Heights Community Centre

properties.Name: Virginia River (To Windsor Lake)
properties.CAPTION: Completed during the 2003 season, with the support of the Airport Heights Residents Committee, this walk provides a delightful route to 'Twenty Mile Road', known since 1812 as Windsor Lake.

properties.Name: Virginia River (To Major's Path)
properties.CAPTION: Bridges, boardwalks, and berms allow walkers to cross wetlands as they travel upstream, passing through urban neighbourhoods along the walk.

properties.Name: Quidi Vidi Lake
properties.CAPTION: This level, 3.8 km trail loops around Quidi Vidi Lake. During the summer rowers prepare for the Royal St. john's Regatta, held here annually in August since 1826. Observe waterfowl and seabirds that use the Lake year-round as a resting and feeding area.

properties.Name: Long Pond to Oxen Pond
properties.CAPTION: This walk begins at the west end of Long Pond, behind the Shamrock Farm and climbs the steep hill towards the MUN Botantical Garden.

properties.Name: South Brook
properties.CAPTION: A lovely Walk that crosses a deep gorge, all within the sights and sounds of South Brook. A historic and beautifully landscaped Park, to be enjoyed by all.

properties.Name: Signal Hill - North Head
properties.CAPTION: An exhilarating hike featuring rugged coastal beauty, striking views, and historic sites. This challenging trail built by Parks Canada descends 500 ft and includes a narrow coastal path along the Narrows.
properties.Parking: Cabot Tower or Signal Hill Visitor's Centre

properties.Name: Military-Rennies-Circular-King's Bridge (South)
properties.CAPTION: Enjoy the splendour of some of the finest heritage houses and public architecture in St. John's. Set in the midst of park and park-like grounds, this area was a political and administrative centre during Newfoundland's century of independence.

properties.Name: Ladies Lookout
properties.CAPTION: This trail offers some of the most magnificent scenery on the Avalon Peninsula. Visit the hill from which the women of early St. John's kept watch for the safe return of their loved ones.

properties.Name: Cuckolds Cove
properties.CAPTION: This scenic Trail mostly follows the old Burma Road to Signal Hill Road, passing by such historic places as Cuckold Cove and George's Pond.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Chamberlains)
properties.CAPTION: Follow the former railway route from the CBS-Paradise boundary into a wooded area. Listen to songbirds in the spring and summer. Chamberlains was historically settled by self-sufficient people who cut their own wood and tilled the fertile soil.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Manuels)
properties.CAPTION: This linear section of the former railway passes over the world-famous Manuels River, an ancient geological feature with fossils dating back 500 million years.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Long Pond)
properties.CAPTION: Continuing West from Manuels River, this route passes through mixed landscapes with historical settlement patterns dating to 1799. End at the Monument of Honour and Town Hall.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Foxtrap)
properties.CAPTION: This section of the T'Railway pass through active farms, some of which have been held for six and seven generations. Railway construction met resistance from farmers here in 1880 and the route was diverted to the shoreline.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Kelligrews)
properties.CAPTION: This scenic route follows the rocky coastline through tuckamore patches and pebble beaches to Kelligrews Pond, a popular site for shorebirds and waterbirds.

properties.Name: Voisey's Brook Park
properties.CAPTION: Experience a variety of landscapes and habitats along the looping conservation trail at Voiseyâ€™s Brook Park off Indian Meal Line.  When complete, the large park will accommodate large recreation events and a wide range of outdoor activities.

properties.Name: Old St. John's Business Streets (Water)
properties.CAPTION: Even when called "the Lower Path", Water Street was the major business street of the old Colony. Enterprises along Water Street developed from a series of fish flakes to a collection of merchants, importers, and traders.

properties.Name: Military-Rennies-Circular-King's Bridge (North)
properties.CAPTION: During the 1800s, especially after the Great Fire of 1846, many merchants discontinued residing above their premises on Water Street and built elaborate private residences "above the hill". This Walk passes by many of these and other prominent buildings.

properties.Name: T'Railway (Upper Gullies)
properties.CAPTION: In 2013, work began on developing the T'Railway through the town of Conception Bay South. The Walk will connect with the Manuels Interpretation Centre and follow the shoreline, eventually as far as Holyrood.

properties.Name: Adam's Pond
properties.CAPTION: When complete, this accessible walk will total nearly 3 kilometres, encircling Adam's Pond with playgrounds, open spaces, and provisioning for water recreation.

properties.Name: Upper Three Corner Pond Park
properties.CAPTION: Located in a large recreation park on Bauline Line, this short loop offers a close look at a serene wetland.

properties.Name: Western Island Pond
properties.CAPTION: This route starts at Western Island Pond Drive and follows behind new subdivisions. When complete, this Walk will connect with and encircle Western Island Pond.

properties.Name: Elizabeth to Queens Road Link
properties.CAPTION: Starting at the very western end of Elizabeth Avenue, this Walk will bring you back into the old city.

properties.Name: Arboretum Walk (South)
properties.CAPTION: This is our longest looped walk, taking you through most of the City of Mount Pearl before connecting back to the T'Railway. Explore the Waterford River ravine, farmland, City Parks and modern neighbourhoods.

properties.Name: Elizabeth Avenue-Prince Phillip East (South)
properties.CAPTION: This sidewalkway features a blend of residential, commercial, government and institutional properties. The north section of the walk passes by the Confederation Building and former farmsteads, that once supplied townspeople with produce.

properties.Name: Elizabeth Avenue-Prince Phillip West (South)
properties.CAPTION: This sidewalkway follows the first, major, divided thoroughfare in St. John's, and takes you through Atlantic Canada's largest University.

properties.Name: Riverdale to Mundy Pond (East)
properties.CAPTION: Linking Rennies River Trail to Mundy Pond, this walk route takes the user through the Kelly's Brook Valley, connecting several municipal parks along the way (St. Pats Ball Park, Lions Park, Kelly's Brook Park and Wedgewood Park).

properties.Name: Rotary Sunshine Park (Gull Pond)
properties.CAPTION: Established 1937 for underpriviledged children, Rotary 'Sunshine' Park, has now become popular for swimming enthusiasts. Quiet backcountry trails offer scenic views of Portugal Cove-St. Philip's
